001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.loss;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.numbers.JavaNumberTypeSupport;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
005
006import java.util.List;
007
008/**
009 * A loss function implementation that computes the mean error
010 * across samples or batches.
011 *
012 * <p>
013 * {@code MeanError} provides a simple averaging strategy for loss
014 * calculation. It can operate both at the sample level
015 * ({@link SampleLossFunction}) and at the batch level
016 * ({@link BatchLossFunction}), making it reusable in different
017 * stages of the loss aggregation hierarchy.
018 * </p>
019 *
020 * <p>
021 * At the sample level, this class typically averages the individual
022 * dimension losses produced by {@link DimensionLossFunction}s.
023 * At the batch level, it averages the losses of all samples within
024 * the batch.
025 * </p>
026 *
027 * <p>
028 * This implementation is often used as a building block in
029 * higher-level objective functions such as Mean Squared Error (MSE)
030 * or Binary Cross-Entropy (BCE), where mean aggregation is required
031 * either per sample, per batch, or both.
032 * </p>
033 *
034 * @see SampleLossFunction
035 * @see BatchLossFunction
036 * @see DimensionLossFunction
037 */
038@Strategy(Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
039public class MeanError<N extends Number> implements SampleLossFunction<N>, BatchLossFunction<N> {
040
041    private final JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport;
042
043    public MeanError(JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport) {
044        this.typeSupport = typeSupport;
045    }
046
047    /**
048     * {@inheritDoc}
049     */
050    @Override
051    public JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> getNumberTypeSupport() {
052        return typeSupport;
053    }
054
055    /**
056     * {@inheritDoc}
057     */
058    @Override
059    public N calculateBatchLoss(List<N> sampleLosses) {
060        N loss = typeSupport.zero();
061        for (N sampleLoss : sampleLosses) {
062            loss = typeSupport.add(loss, sampleLoss);
063        }
064        return typeSupport.divide(loss, sampleLosses.size());
065    }
066
067    /**
068     * {@inheritDoc}
069     */
070    @Override
071    public N calculateGradient_dJ_dL(int batchSize) {
072        return typeSupport.divide(typeSupport.one(), batchSize);
073    }
074
075    /**
076     * {@inheritDoc}
077     */
078    @Override
079    public N calculateSampleLoss(List<N> dimensionLosses) {
080        N loss = typeSupport.zero();
081        for (N dimensionLoss : dimensionLosses) {
082            loss = typeSupport.add(loss, dimensionLoss);
083        }
084        return typeSupport.divide(loss, dimensionLosses.size());
085    }
086
087    /**
088     * {@inheritDoc}
089     */
090    @Override
091    public N calculateGradient_dL_dl(int dimensions) {
092        return typeSupport.divide(typeSupport.one(), dimensions);
093    }
094
095}
